metadata.title: CVE-2020-20703 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in VIM v.8.1.2135 allows a remote attacker toexecute arbitrary code via the operand parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-20703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-athena - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-nox - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
xxd - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.3').
